All-night sit-in strike in South Korea
articles.content:
All-night sit-in strike in South Korea
     Pyongyang, July 6 (KCNA) -- Leading members of the (South) Korean Confederation of Trade Unions (KCTU) have been on an all-night sit-in strike since July 2 as the strike of hospital workers and taxi drivers unions is likely to go on for an indefinite period, Seoul-based radio no. 1 reported.
 They criticized the management sides for their insincere behavior though the Kangnam Virgin Mary Hospital, Pusan heavy industrial and Inchon taxi drivers unions have been on strikes for over 40 days.    
 They urged the management sides to sincerely respond to the negotiations with trade unions calling for the guarantee of vital rights, expressing their resolution to struggle against the evermore undisguised suppression by the police.

Greetings to Nepalese king
articles.content:
Greetings to Nepalese king
    Pyongyang, July 6 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, today sent a message of congratulations to Nepalese king Gyanendra Bir Bikram shah dev on the occasion of his 55th birthday.
 Expressing belief that the relations between the two countries would grow stronger, he wished him bigger success in his noble work for the stability of his country and national prosperity.

articles.title: Greetings to Indian FM
articles.content:
Greetings to Indian FM
    Pyongyang, July 6 (KCNA) -- Minister of foreign affairs Paek Nam Sun sent a message of greetings to new Indian foreign minister Jasvant Singh.
 Expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger as required by the new century, the message wholeheartedly wished him success in his responsible work.
